Module contents¶

class pymerkle.merkle_tree(*records, hash_type='sha256', encoding='utf-8', security=True, log_dir='/home/beast/projects/pymerkle/docs', leaves=None, nodes=None, root=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

Class for Merkle-Trees

Note

Cf. the API to see how this constructor should actually be called externally by a user

Parameters:
  • hash_type (str) – <str> hash algorithm configuration. Must be among the hard-coded strings contained in the hash_machine.HASH_ALGORITHM_TYPES global variable (upper- or mixed-case with ‘-‘ instead of ‘_’ allowed), otherwise an exception is thrown; defaults to ‘sha256’ if unspecified.
  • encoding (str) – <str> encoding algorithm configuration. Must be among the hard-coded elements of the encodings.ENCODINGS global variable, otherwise an exception is thrown; defaults to utf_8 if unspecified
  • security (bool) – <bool> configures security mode of the underlying hash machine, i.e., defense against second-preimage attack; genuinely activated only for the default values of the hash and ecoding types (SHA256, resp. UTF-8)
  • *records –

    <str> or <bytes> or <bytearray>; thought of as the records initially stored by the tree, usually empty at construction

  • log_dir (str) – <str> absolute path of the directory, where the merkle-tree will receive the log files to encrypt from; defaults to the current working directory if unspecified
  • leaves (list of nodes.leaf) – <None>
  • nodes (set of nodes.node) – <None>
  • root (nodes.node) – <None>

or :param hash_type : <str> see above :param encoding : <str> see above :param security : <bool> see above :param log_dir : <str> see above :param leaves : <list [of <leaf>]> initial leaves of the tree under construction :param nodes : <set [of <node>]> initial nodes of the tree under construction :param root : <node> root of the tree under construction

Variables:
  • uuid – (builtin_function_or_method) Hash algorithm used by the machine. Defaults to SHA256.
  • machine – (str) Encoding type used by the machine while hashing. Defaults to UTF-8.
  • hash_type – (bool) Indicates that defense against second-preimage attack is activated (genuinely only for default values of hash and encoding types). Defaults to True.
  • encoding – (bool) Indicates that defense against second-preimage attack is activated (genuinely only for default values of hash and encoding types). Defaults to True.
  • security – (bool) Indicates that defense against second-preimage attack is activated (genuinely only for default values of hash and encoding types). Defaults to True.
  • hash – (bool) Indicates that defense against second-preimage attack is activated (genuinely only for default values of hash and encoding types). Defaults to True.
  • multi_hash – (bool) Indicates that defense against second-preimage attack is activated (genuinely only for default values of hash and encoding types). Defaults to True.
  • log_dir – (bool) Indicates that defense against second-preimage attack is activated (genuinely only for default values of hash and encoding types). Defaults to True.
  • leaves – (bool) Indicates that defense against second-preimage attack is activated (genuinely only for default values of hash and encoding types). Defaults to True.
  • nodes – (bool) Indicates that defense against second-preimage attack is activated (genuinely only for default values of hash and encoding types). Defaults to True.
  • root – (bool) Indicates that defense against second-preimage attack is activated (genuinely only for default values of hash and encoding types). Defaults to True.
JSONstring()[source]¶

Returns a nicely stringified version of the Merkle-Tree’s JSON serialized form

Note

The output of this function is to be passed in the print() function

Return type:str
audit_proof(arg)[source]¶

Returns audit proof appropriately formatted along with its validation parameters (so that it be insertible as the second argument to the validations.validate_proof() method) :param arg : <str>/<bytes>/<bytearray> or <int>; the record (if type is <str>/<bytes>/<bytearray>) or index

of leaf (if type is <int>) where the proof calculation must be based upon (provided by Client Side)

:returns : <proof.proof> proof content in nice format with validation parameters

clear()[source]¶

Deletes all nodes of the tree

consistency_proof(old_hash, sublength)[source]¶

Returns consistency proof appropriately formatted along with its validation parameters (so that it be insertible as the second argument to the validations.validate_proof() method) :param old_hash : <str> top-hash of the tree to be presumably detected as a previous state of the current

one and whose consistency is about to be validated or not (Client Side)

:param sublength : <int> length of the above tree (Client Side) :returns : <proof.proof> proof content in nice format with validation parameters

display(indent=3)[source]¶

Prints the Merkle-Tree in a terminal friendy way

Printing the tree is similar to what is printed at console when running the tree command of Unix based platforms.

Parameters:indent (int) – [optional] The horizontal depth at which each level will be indented with respect to its previous one. Defaults to 3.
encrypt_log(log_file)[source]¶

Encrypts the data of the provided log-file into the Merkle-Tree.

More accurately, it updates the tree by successively updating it with each line of the log-file provided (cf. doc of the .update method)

Parameters:log_file (str) – relative path of the log-file under enryption, specified with respect to the Merkle-Tree’s directory log_dir
height()[source]¶

Calculates and returns the Merkle-Tree’s current height

Since the tree is by construction binary balanced, its height coincides with the length of its leftmost branch.

Return type:int
length()[source]¶

Returns the Merkle-Tree’s current length (i.e., the nuber of its leaves)

Return type:int
root_hash()[source]¶

Returns current top-hash of the Merkle-Tree,i.e., the hash stored by its current root

Returns:The tree’s current root hash in hexadecimal form
Return type:str
serialize()[source]¶

Returns a JSON structure with the Merkle-Trees’s current characteristics as key-value pairs

Return type:dict

Note

This method does not serialize the tree structure itself, but only the info about the tree’s current state

size()[source]¶

Returns the current number of the Merkle-Tree’s nodes

Return type:int
update(record)[source]¶

Updates the Merkle-Tree by storing the hash of the inserted record in a newly created leaf, restructuring the tree appropriately and recalculating all necessary interior hashes

Parameters:record (str or bytes or bytearray) – the record whose hash is to be stored in a the leaf
pymerkle.validate_proof(target_hash, proof)[source]¶

Core validation function

Validates the inserted proof by comparing to the provided target hash, modifies the proof’s status as True or False according to validation result and returns this result.

Parameters:
  • target_hash (str) – hash (hexadecimal form) to be presumably attained at the end of the validation procedure (i.e., acclaimed top-hash of the Merkle-Tree having provided the proof)
  • proof (proof.proof) – the proof to be validated
Returns:

validation result
Return type:

bool
class pymerkle.proof_validator(validations_dir=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

Wrapper of the validate_proof function.

Employs the validation_receipt class in order to organize validation results in an easy storable way.

Parameters:validations_dir (str) – [optional] absolute path of the directory where validation receipts will be stored as .json files. Defaults to None, in which case validation receipts will not be automatically stored.
validate(target_hash, proof)[source]¶

Wraps validate_proof, returning a validation receipt instead of a boolean.

If a validations_dir has been specified at construction, then the produced validation receipt is automatically stored in that directory as a .json file named with the receipt’s uuid.

Parameters:
  • target_hash (str) – hash (hexadecimal form) to be presumably attained at the end of the validation procedure (i.e., acclaimed top-hash of the Merkle-Tree having provided the proof)
  • proof (proof.proof) – the proof to be validated
Return type:

validations.validation_receipt
